div.head: THE EGYPTIAN GAZETTE
No. 7,689] ALEXANDRIA, MONDAY, FEBRUARY 18, 1907. [EIGHT PAGES P.T. 1.
The Eastern Telegraph Company, Limited.
div.p:
This Company's system of submarine telegraph
cables is the most direct and quickest means of
communication from Egypt to Europe, North and
South America, East, South and West Africa,
India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan.

To secure quick transmission, telegrams should
be marked Via Eastern.

For latest average time to London, see daily
bulletin in this paper.

STATIONS IN EGYPT: Alexandria, Cairo,
Suez, Port-Tewfik, Port-Saïd, Suakin. Head
Office. London.
Throw Steel Nibs Away!
They waste time, are costly to use, wear out, scratch, etc.
Try a "Swan" Fountain Pen.
Prices from 10/6
Sold by all Stationers and Importers in Cairo and Alexandria.
Catalogue free.
Mable, Todd & Bard, High Holborn, London.

div.head: Orient-Royal Mail Line.
div.p: REDUCED SUMMER FARES FROM MAY TO OCTOBER INCLUSIVE.
OUTWARD to AUSTRALIA.
R.M.S. “Omrah" will leave Suez about February 22
R.M.S "Oroya" will leave Suez about March 8.
HOMEWARD to NAPLES, MARSEILLES, GIBRALTAR, PLYMOUTH, LONDON, TILBURY.
R.M.S. "O mus" will leave Port Said February 22
R.M.S. “Orient" will leave Port Said March 11

The issue of return tickets to and from Egypt has been discontinued. Passengers paying full fare one direction will, however, be allowed abatement of one-third off fare back if return voyage be made within four months of arrival, or abatement of 20 o/o if return voyage be made within six months of arrival.
Special reduced rates during Summer season 15th May - 15th September.
Agents, Cairo: Thomas Cook & Son, Ltd. ; Alexandria : R. J. Moss & Co.
For all imformation apply to Wm. STAPLEDON & Sons, PORT SAID and PORT-TEWFIK (Suez). 31-12-6

div.head: BIBBY LINE MAIL TWIN-SCREW STEAMERS.
div.p: OUTWARDS to COLOMBO, TUTICORIN, etc., and RANGOON.
S.S. Cheshire 5,775 tons, will leave Suez about February 28.
HOMEWARDS to MARSEILLES and LONDON.
S.S. Herefordshire 7,182 tons, will leave Port Said about March 3rd.
Fares from Port Said to Marseilles £12.0.0 ; London £17.0.0 ; Colombo £32.10.0 ; Rangood £37.10.0
Fitted with Refigerators, Electric Light, Electric Fans and all recent improvements.
SPECIAL REDUCED FARES DURING THE SUMMER SEASON. 12-931
Agents in Cairo: THOS. COOK & SON. For all particulars apply to Suez & Port Said : WM. STAPLEDON & SONS PORT SAID PORT TEWFIK (Suez).

div.head: Deutsche Levante-Linie.
div.p: Mail and Passenger Steamships. Regular service fortnightly from HAMBURG; weekly from ANTWERP & every 4 weeks from BORDEAUX direct to ALEXANDRIA ; homewards every 2 weeks from ALEXANDRIA for RUTTERDAM and HAMBURG. Goods forwarded at through-ates from all German Railway Stations on Direct Bills of Landing to ALEXANDRIA, CAIRO, SYRIA, etc. Special facilities for conveyance of cotton, etc. from Alexandria via Rotterdam and Hamburg to German manufacturing towns.
EXPECTED:-.
February 17S.S. Rhodos from Hamburg will sail for Rotterdam and Hamburg on or the 25th inst.
For tariff and particulars apply to ADOLPHE STROSS, Alexandria, Agent.

div.head: KHEDIVIAL MAIL LINE.
div.p: Express Steamers leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIRAEUS, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London.

Fast steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 6 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazareth), BEYROUT (for Damascus), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate weeks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus).

Steamers leave Suez fortnightly on Wednesday at 6 p.m. for JEDDAH, SUAKIN, MASSOWAH, HODBIDAH, and ADEN ; and in the intervening weeks for PORT SUDAN and SUAKIN direct. Calls will be made at TOR (for Mount Sinai) as required.
N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free.
Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company’s Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at THOS. COOK & SON or other Tourist Agency.

div.head: The Moss S.S. Company, Ltd.
div.p: For LIVERPOOL calling at MALTA (Messrs. JAMES MOSS & Co. 31, James St, Liverpool, Managers.)

*Second class accommodation only, unless specially reserved.—Fares : Alexandria to Liverpool, 1st, £14 Single, £25 Return. 2nd, £9 Single, £15 Return.—To Malta, 1st, £5 Single, £9 Return, 2nd, £3 Single, £5 Return.—Return tickets available for six months.
S.S. Menepthah now on the berth, will sail on or about Monday, 18th February, to be followed by S.S. Busiriss.
Through freight rates on cotton, etc., to Lancashire inland towns, Boston, New York and other U.S.A. towns, obtained on application. Cargo taken by special agreement only.
R. J. MOSS & Co., Alexandria, Agents.

div.head: P. HENDERSON & CO’s LINE.
div.p: Steamers of this line leave SUEZ and PORT SAID fortnightly for LONDON or LIVERPOOL direct.
SALOON FARE £12.
S.S. AMARAPOORA 6600 Tons will leave ALEXANDRIA about 16th of February for Liverpool.
" ABRACAN 6000 " " " 22nd of February for Liverpool.
" MANDALAY 5600 " " " August 20 for Liverpool
Due in LONDON or LIVERPOOL in 13 days.
The Saloon accomodations are amidships, and the vessels are fitted throughout with Electric Light, and have all the latest improvements.
For further information apply to the company's agents.
WORMS AND CO., Port Said and Suez. THOS. COOK AND SON (EGYPT) LD>, Cairo
G. J. GRACE & CO., ALEXANDRIA.

div.head: WHITE STAR LINE.
div.p: NEW YORK AND BOSTON MEDITERRANEAN SERVICE.

Regular Sailings between Alexandria , Naples, and Boston or New York, U.S.A. By the large modern twin screw steamers CELTIC, 21,035 tons - CELTIC, 21,035 tons- REPUBLIC, 15,400 tons- CANOPIC, 13,000 tons.

Regular Service between Italy and United States throughout the year. Excellent accommodation for all classes of passengers. For plans of steamers, rates of passengers between the various ports, and full particulars, apply to THOS, COOK & SON (Egypt) Ltd., Cairo, Alexandria, Luxor and Assouan; John Ross & Co., Alexandria; White Star Line, Via Roma, Gena, and 21, Piazza della Borsa, Naples.

SPECIAL NOTICE.- The "Canopic" from Alexandria on March 18 will call at Palermo on March 16 en route to Naples. An excellent opportunity is thus afforded for passengers to visit Sicily direct from Alexandria by a first class Ocean steamer.

div.head: Austrian Lloyd’s Steam Navigation
div.p: Alexandria-Brindisi-Venice Trieste. Express Mail Service. Steamers leave Alexandria Saturdays 4 p.m. arrive at Brindisi Tuesdays 5 a.m. in time for Express to Milan, Lucerne, Paris, Vienna, Berlin, London, leaving Brindisi 7 a.m. Arrival at Venice Wednesday about 8.30 a.m. Passengers may proceed from Venice to Switzerland, Paris and London by the 2 p.m. and 11.5 p.m. – Expresses. Arrival at Trieste Wednesday about 3 p.m. in connection with the Train de Luxe proceeding the same evening to Vienna, Frankfort, Cologne, Brussel, Ostende and London. Arrival at London every Friday 5.12 p.m.
Special Train Service from Cairo Station to Alexandria Quay alongside steamer, Saturdays at 9.30 a.m.
Steamer leaves Alexandria every Thursday 10 a.m. On and from April 11th at 4 p.m.
Syrian-Cyprus Line. Beyrout, Limassol, Larnaca, Mersina, Febr. 26; March 12, 26 ; April 9. 23 ; May 7, 21 ; June 4, 18.

To Suez, Aden and Bombay accelerated service 22 Febr.; 7, 23 March ; 4, 23 April ; 8 May ; 8 June.

div.head: THE NATIONAL HOTEL, Cairo
div.p:
One of the finest and most up-to-date Hotels in the Metropolis. Situated in
Sharia Soliman Pasha, the very centre of the healthiest and most fashionable
quarter. Stands in its own grounds with garden and lawn tennis grounds at back.
Over 350 rooms and 5 saloons. Magnificent salle à manger. Handsome covered
promenade verandah, 80 yards long. Highest class cuisine, electric light
throughout, and lifts. English comforts. Rooms and apartments at prices to suit
everyone. For further particulars apply to GENERAL MANAGER, Cairo.

div.head: EASTERN EXCHANGE HOTEL, PORT SAID.
div.p: First Class Hotel. Modern in all respects.
The Coolest Summer Residence in Egypt.

Fire-proof, Drained to the Sea, Lifts, Electric Light, English and French
Billiards, Fresh and Salt Water Baths.
Hotel Dragomans in Uniform Meet all Trains and Steamers.

Special terms to Cairo Residents and their families desirous of enjoying the cool
air and sea bathing during the summer months.

div.head: NEW VICTORIA HOTEL,
div.p: Open all the year round.
San Stefano, Near Alexandria, Halt No. 2.

Specially built in 1904 for a class Hotel with every modern comfort. Magnificent
Dining room, Saloons, Smoking room, largo Verandahs and Garden. Electric light.
MODERATE CHARGES. Ten minutes by carriage or Palais tram from Sidi
Gaber.—Special terms for Government Officials and Officers of the Army of
Occupation. C. F. RAISIG. Manager.
RESTAURANT AND BAR OPEN TO NON-RESIDENTS.

div.head: Tewfik Palace Hotel.
div.p: Helouan, near Cairo.

Formerly the favourite Residence of H.H. the Khedive. Perfect Sanitation.–Purest
Desert air. Electric Light. Hot and old baths attached to most rooms. House
warmed by special system of Radiators, adjoining the Golf Links and Race Course,
Tennis, Billiards, Garden and open air palm house, good stabling , dark room.
Excellent Table. Moderate Charges.

Medical Resident Director: Arthur J.M. Bentley, M.D. –Town Office at Stephenson
& Co., Opera Square, Cairo.

div.head: GRAND HOTEL KHARTOUM, SUDAN
div.p: SUDAN.
First Class. Open all the year round.
THOROUGHLY RENOVATED AND IMPROVED.

Standing in a magnificent position in its own extensive grounds on the
banks of the Blue Nile. Perfect climate, no mosquitoes, moder comfort, very homely.
Concerts twice a week on the verandah of the Hotel.
ENTIRELY NEW MANAGEMENT.
For accommodation please write or wire beforehand to Manager

cell.p: It is understood that an Irish Devolution

Bill will be presented as a provisional experi­ment and the arrangements for the constitu­tion of the Irish Council will be left open for enlargement for 10 years’ time. It is expected that the lrish Commoners will be ipso facto members of the new Council. The success of the experiment will depend upon the Council's disposal of the money scorning from savings under the Imperial administration. (Reuter}
A great political demonstration took place

hero last night. Sir G Farrar declared that the Progressives were fighting for God and the King against oligarchy and the autocracy, and they must work for the establishment of a British South Africa and to eliminate Down ing Street influence. (Reuter)
Lord Charles Beresford is paying a visit to Mexico.

In the course of an interview he stated that he had declined to take the command of the Channel Fleet unless certain modifications were made. He had agreed to accept it when these had been carried out and approved by him. (I enter

Despite semi-official denials, the newspapers publish persistent rumours of serions dissension between M. Clemenceau and M. Briand with regard to the Church question, which, they say, will shortly lead to developments (Reuter)
Washington February 17. The Senate adopted the amended Immigra-

tion Bill without a division. Consequently the difficulty with Japan has been settled, the Californians having agreed to admit Japanese children to the schools attended by whites immediately the bill was passed. ( Reuter)
Constantinople February 16. Fehim Pashs, chief of the secret police,
having sequenstrated a ship going to Hamburg, the German Ambassador demanded his punish­ment. The Saltan has exiled Fehim to B o»R,
Constantinople, February 17. Fehim Pasha has been sent to exile. He has
St. Petersburg, February 16. The organs of the Constitutional Democrats
claim that the latter have secured a large majority in the Duma, and insist therefore that M. Stolypin must resign. (Reuter)

The Minister of the Colonies declares that the contract between the British and French railway companies for an extension to Addis- Abeba is a violation of the Convention of 1902, though it was possible that the contract would ultimately be sanctioned. (Reuter)
London, February 16 Football. Association. England beat Ireland
The agreement for the construction of the Laokai Yunnansen railway has been signed here by the representative* of the Government and the Indo-Chinese Railway Company. (R.)
Princess Marie Clementine, mother of Prince Ferdinand of Bulgaria, is dead. (R.)
The Archduchess Clementine of Coburg is dead. (Havas)
Belgrade February 17. Three regicide officers attacked two tepn'ies
with swords in the streets of the city. A fierce fight ensued in which a deputy was dangerous- ly wounded. (Reuter}
Bologna, February 16. Owing to the death of Carducci, which re-
curred yesterday, mourning is general through- Italy. (Havas)
Boni, February 17. The suburbs beginning from the villa are
inundated. Several native families have pe- rished. -The damages exceed a million (francs)
